summary: Implement BIP-AI RBAC for tooling ArgoCD to allow management of applications
description:
Title: Implement BIP-AI RBAC for tooling ArgoCD to allow management of applications

Value Statement As a BIP-AI Infrastructure Engineer, I need to implement RBAC (Role-Based Access Control) for tooling ArgoCD, so that I can enable proper access management and security controls for application deployment and management within the BIP-AI platform. Description This story involves implementing comprehensive RBAC policies for the tooling ArgoCD instance to ensure proper access control, security boundaries, and operational governance for application management for BIP AI Infrastructure engineers. The implementation will follow security best practices and integrate with existing authentication and authorization systems.

A/C: When I implement RBAC policies for tooling ArgoCD, then I need to: Define appropriate roles and permissions for different user types (developers, operators, administrators) Configure RBAC policies that align with BIP-AI security requirements Implement proper access controls for application management operations Follow existing RBAC patterns and conventions used in the BIP platform When I configure the RBAC integration, then it needs to: Integrate with existing authentication systems (OIDC, SSO) Support fine-grained permissions for different environments (dev, staging, prod) Enable proper application lifecycle management controls Restrict access based on user roles and project boundaries When I test the RBAC implementation, then it needs to: Successfully authenticate and authorize users based on their roles Properly enforce permission boundaries for application operations Handle different user scenarios (create, read, update, delete applications) Work correctly in ephemeral environment for validation When I validate the RBAC functionality, then it needs to: Demonstrate proper access control enforcement Show correct permission inheritance and role mapping Handle edge cases and unauthorized access attempts appropriately Maintain audit trails for access and operations Definition of Done: RBAC policies implemented and configured for tooling ArgoCD Integration with authentication systems completed Comprehensive testing performed in ephemeral environment PR created with approvals from Engineering team Documentation updated with RBAC configuration and usage patterns

summary: Add model registration (to SageMaker model registry) to lifecycle tenant resources notebook
description:
Title
Create a section in sagemaker lifecycle notebook to demonstrate SageMaker model registration

Value Statement
As an MLOps Engineer who supports tenant teams in building and deploying ML models, I need the ability to demonstrate how to register a trained model in SageMaker using the sagemaker lifecycle notebook in the bip-ai-tenant-resources repository so that tenants can understand and adopt SageMaker model registration in their own workflows for better model traceability and deployment readiness.

Acceptance Criteria
When a user runs the sagemaker lifecycle notebook, the user has the ability to:
- Understand what SageMaker model registration is and when to use it

- Execute an example that registers a trained model

summary: Add MLflow usage to lifecycle tenant resources notebook
description:
Title
Add MLflow tutorial section to sagemaker lifecycle notebook to guide tenants on logging metrics, parameters, and model artifacts

Value Statement
As an MLOps Engineer who supports tenant teams in developing ML workflows, I need the ability to demonstrate how to use MLflow to log parameters, metrics, and model artifacts in the sagemaker_lifecycle notebook in the bip-ai-tenant-resources repository so that tenants can adopt consistent, traceable, and well-documented experiment tracking practices in their own projects.

Acceptance Criteria
When a tenant reviews and runs the sagemaker_lifecycle tutorial notebook, they have the ability to:

- Understand how to log training parameters to MLflow

- Log evaluation metrics to MLflow

- Log artifacts to MLflow

- See clearly documented examples and guidance in markdown cells

summary: Build initial smoke test pipeline to validate Crossplane readiness and legacy domain health
description:
As a BIP AI engineer who ensures system stability after infrastructure changes, I need the ability to validate Crossplane composition readiness and confirm existing domains continue to function after new domain additions so that we can safely catch regressions and prevent breaking deployments.

When a smoke test pipeline is triggered, it must include a stage that queries the Crossplane API and confirms that the relevant composition is in a Ready state before proceeding.
When the Crossplane check passes, the next stage must load a list of previously registered domains (excluding newly added ones) and verify that they are accessible and behaving correctly using Playwright.
The implementation must include or reference a deltas file or similar mechanism that identifies which domains are newly added vs pre-existing.
The Playwright checks must log success or failure for each domain and fail the pipeline if any existing domains are non-functional.

summary: Update domain execution role IaC to add short domain name in policy condition

Acceptance Criteria

1. Add short domain name in addition to domainID for secrets
2. Add short domain name in addition to domainID for endpoint
3. Also Investigate the trust policy wildcard arn from ai core domains.

3. add sagemaker:CreateAppImageConfig
sagemaker:DescribeAppImageConfig for custom image attachment.

4. add spa domainid and bucket.

Reference:
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/bedrock/latest/userguide/guardrails-permissions.html

summary: Investigate Entra ID service Accounts and X509 certificate for Bruno API pipeline authentication
description:
As a bip ai engineer who automates API testing using Bruno cli, I need the ability to securely authenticate using Entra ID service accounts or an X509 Certificate so that tests can run in CI/CD pipelines without exposing user credentials or relying on manual login steps.

 

When a Bruno CLI test is triggered in the pipeline, the service can authenticate using an Entra ID -ssued service account token to access protected APIs.
When authentication succeeds, the Bruno CLI can send API requests to endpoints protected by Okta without manual intervention.
-- Documentation and architecture around authentication workflow for entra id service accounts and x509 certificate for pipeline authentcation

summary: Develop interactive front-end table for Crossplane resources with filtering and action capabilities to enhance admin controls
description:
Title: Develop interactive front-end table for Crossplane resources with filtering and action capabilities to enhance admin controls

Description: Create a Vue.js front-end component that displays all Crossplane resources (claims, composites, and managed resources) in an interactive table format. The component will consume data from the existing FastAPI endpoint that returns resource information as a dictionary with multiple parameters. The table will provide filtering capabilities, resource selection for actions, status display based on annotations, and direct links to resource manifests.

Value Statement: By providing an interactive front-end interface for all Crossplane resources, administrators gain a centralized view with filtering and action capabilities, improving operational efficiency and reducing the time needed to manage and monitor infrastructure resources.

Acceptance Criteria: • Vue.js component displays all Crossplane resources (claims, composites, managed resources) in a table format • Interactive search bar allows filtering of resources by name, type, or other relevant attributes • Table includes columns for resource name, type, namespace, status, and manifest link • Resource status is displayed based on the crossplane.io/paused annotation from API response • Checkboxes or selection mechanism allows users to select individual or multiple resources • Action buttons enable pause/resume operations on selected resources • Manifest column contains clickable links to view resource YAML definitions • Table design and styling matches existing "list paused resources" component format • Component integrates seamlessly with existing Vue.js application structure • Responsive design ensures table works across different screen sizes • Loading states and error handling are implemented for API interactions • Local development and testing completed using minikube cluster • Component follows existing UI patterns and design system

Definition of Done: • Vue.js component is fully implemented and functional • All filtering and selection features work correctly • Pause/resume actions integrate with existing API endpoints • Manifest links properly display resource definitions • Component styling matches existing application design • Local testing completed against minikube cluster with real data • Code follows Vue.js best practices and team coding standards • Component is ready for deployment to SBX environment • Documentation includes component usage and integration instructions

summary: Prototype Bedrock Crossplane Providers to enable Knowledge Base Provisioning
description:
Value Statement: As a BIP-AI Infrastructure engineer, I need to create comprehensive CompositeResourceDefinitions (XRDs) that define the schema and API contract for Bedrock Knowledge Base resources, including all necessary fields such as knowledge base name, description, role ARN, data source configurations, vector database settings, and embedding model specifications. 

Acceptance Criteria:

XRD Development: The XRDs must include proper validation rules, required fields, and default values to ensure consistent and secure knowledge base provisioning across different environments.

Composition Implementation: I need to develop Crossplane compositions that orchestrate the creation of AWS Bedrock Knowledge Bases along with their dependencies, including S3 buckets for data sources, IAM roles with appropriate permissions for Bedrock service access, vector databases (such as Amazon OpenSearch Serverless or Pinecone), and proper networking configurations. The compositions must handle resource ordering, dependency management, and include error handling for failed provisioning scenarios while supporting multiple deployment environments (dev, staging, production).

Claims and Testing: I need to create working claim examples that demonstrate end-to-end knowledge base provisioning, including sample data ingestion workflows and validation that the knowledge bases are functional and queryable. The implementation must include comprehensive testing through multiple claim scenarios, verification that knowledge bases appear correctly in the AWS Bedrock console, confirmation that vector embeddings are generated and stored properly, and validation that the knowledge bases can successfully respond to queries with relevant information retrieval.

Documentation and Integration: The story is complete when all components are fully documented with clear examples, troubleshooting guides, and integration patterns that align with existing Crossplane infrastructure, enabling other teams to easily provision and manage Bedrock knowledge bases through declarative YAML configurations without requiring deep AWS Bedrock expertise.

summary: Prototype Bedrock Crossplane Providers to enable Agent Provisioning Follow up
description:
Value Statment: As a BIP-AI Infrastructure engineer, I need to successfully create AWS Bedrock Agents through Crossplane compositions so that our AI infrastructure can provision intelligent agents automatically. 

Acceptance Criteria: The current compositions deploy without errors but fail to create the actual Bedrock agents, requiring investigation into the providerConfig configuration, IAM permissions, and resource dependencies. This story is complete when a Crossplane composition can successfully provision a functional Bedrock agent in AWS, including proper authentication setup through providerConfig, validation that the agent appears in the AWS Bedrock console, and verification that the agent can respond to basic queries, with all troubleshooting steps documented for future reference.

summary: Confirm discrepancy between alerting and new pipeline schedule
description:
Title Update existing Bedrock invocation panel from being single value to aggregated values

Value Statement As Gen Ann, who uses AWS Bedrock services, I need the ability to view Bedrock invocation metrics in an aggregated manner. Acceptance Criteria When Gen Ann accesses the Grafana dashboard, Bedrock invocation metrics are aggregated. Aggregation should be sum total group by week for the last 4 weeks.

summary: Provide adhoc support to Exam Verification team to resolve technical issues
Update existing Bedrock invocation panel from being single value to aggregated values
description:
Title
Update existing Bedrock invocation panel from being single value to aggregated values 

Value Statement
As Gen Ann, who uses AWS Bedrock services, I need the ability to view Bedrock invocation metrics in an aggregated manner. 


Acceptance Criteria

When Gen Ann accesses the Grafana dashboard, Bedrock invocation metrics are aggregated.
Aggregation should be sum total group by week for the last 4 weeks.

summary: SE Support To Support Tenant Exam Verification Adhoc Requests
Build SPA Prod deployment pipeline and have it pull model from preprod model registry
description:
Title
Update SPA Prod deployment pipeline to pull model from preprod

Value Statement
As a BIP AI Tenant who manages SPA models, I need the ability to update the prod deployment pipeline so the model is pulled from the preprod model registry

Acceptance Criteria

When the SPA prod deployment pipeline is triggered, it pulls the model from the preprod SageMaker model registry

summary: Model endpoint metrics in Grafana
description:
Initiative:

As a BIP AI MLOps developer,I need to develop in Grafana to pull SageMaker model endpoint metrics so we can monitor endpoint metrics in DEV
AC:
Pull endpoint metrics (utilization and latency) to MLOPS dashboard in dev
Provide multi-endpoint selection

summary: Document pain points for improvements when developing with respect to tenants on BIP-AI platform
description:
Value Statement: As a BIP-AI developer and tenant, I want to capture the pain points (difficulties) when developing on the BIP-AI platform so that we may improve the user experience.
AC: Confluence page with painpoints outlined and explained.

summary: Researching system access to ArgoCD/SBX Cluster
description:
Value Statement: As an Infrastructure Engineer, I need to understand what my current access to the system is and how it impacts the workload that I will be assigned, in terms of ArgoCD, SBX, Ephemeral Cluster, and creating a jumpbox in AWS.
A/C:
Researching my current capabilities as an admin and what deficiencies in terms of access I lack to complete future work
Understanding the larger organization infrastructure to reach out to the right groups to get the necessary access
Attempting to find the best work around, if  possible, to remediate the current blockers to work on future tickets with ease
